sub_topic: Identifying the type of inorganic compound (ionic, covalent, metallic)
message_1: Identify the type of inorganic compound formed between sodium and chlorine atoms in sodium chloride?
message_2: Sodium chloride (NaCl) is an inorganic compound formed between sodium (Na) and chlorine (Cl) atoms. The type of inorganic compound it forms is an ionic compound, specifically a metal halide, as it consists of a metal (sodium) and a halogen (chlorine) that are held together by ionic bonds.
